title: Miti: 2,288 EV charging stations installed as of March
summary: A total of 268 electric vehicle (EV) charging stations have been operational, bringing the total number of EV charging bays to 2,288 units as of March 2024, according to the Ministry of Investment, Trade, and Industry (Miti).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): A total of 268 electric vehicle (EV) charging stations have been operational, bringing the total number of EV charging bays to 2,288 units as of March 2024, according to the Ministry of Investment, Trade, and Industry (Miti).

Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said that while the goal of 10,000 new charging stations remains unchanged, the target for direct current fast chargers had been increased from 1,000 to 1,500 stations.

title: Twelve police reports lodged, five investigation papers opened over Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election
summary: A total of 12 police reports for various offences were received with five investigation papers opened during the Kuala Kubu Baharu state by-election campaign period that ended on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): A total of 12 police reports for various offences were received with five investigation papers opened during the Kuala Kubu Baharu state by-election campaign period that ended on Saturday.

Selangor police chief Datuk Hussein Omar Khan said that since the campaign period started on April 27, two arrests had been made based on the reports, and seven of the total reports involved only preventive action by police.

“The two men arrested were in

title: PH's victory margin wider than expected in Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election, say analysts
summary:
Pakatan Harapan’s (PH) victory in the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election was widely expected by political analysts. 

Even so, they had expected it to be closer fought.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 11): Pakatan Harapan’s (PH) victory in the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election was widely expected by political analysts. 

Even so, they had expected it to be closer fought.

PH-DAP’s Pang Sock Tao secured 14,000 votes, a 3,869-vote majority over Perikatan Nasional-Bersatu (PN-Bersatu) candidate Khairul Azhari Saut’s 10,131 votes in the by-election that came to a close on Saturday night.

title: PH wins in Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election with a majority of 3,869 votes
summary: Pakatan Harapan-DAP’s (PH-DAP) Pang Sock Tao has emerged victorious in the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election, with a 3,869-vote margin over Perikatan Nasional-Bersatu (PN-Bersatu) candidate Khairul Azhari Saut.

title: Polling ends, vote-tallying process begins for Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election
summary: The polling process for the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election, which began at 8am on Saturday, concluded at 6pm when all 18 polling centres were closed.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 11): The polling process for the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election, which began at 8am on Saturday, concluded at 6pm when all 18 polling centres were closed.

A total of 17 polling centres were closed at 6pm except for Sekolah Jenis Kebangsaan Cina Bukit Fraser,  which closed at 2pm. It catered for only 40 voters.

All ballot boxes from the 74 voting streams were taken to the Dewan Serbaguna dan Kompleks Sukan Da

title: Bursa's average daily trading value jumps 42% to RM2.9b in 4M2024
summary: Bursa Malaysia’s average daily trading value (ADTV) jumped 42% to RM2.9 billion in the first four months of 2024 (4M2024), showing the vibrancy of the local equity market since early this year.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): Bursa Malaysia’s average daily trading value (ADTV) jumped 42% to RM2.9 billion in the first four months of 2024 (4M2024), showing the vibrancy of the local equity market since early this year.

Bursa Malaysia Bhd chief executive officer Datuk Muhamad Umar Swift said just this week, the local market capitalisation hit a record high of RM2 trillion, with the benchmark index of FBM KLCI surpassing 1,600 points for the first time in two years.

title: Loke says e-hailing price bidding system never approved by MOT
summary: The Ministry of Transport (MOT) has never allowed any e-hailing service provider to use the price bidding system for passengers in the country, said Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook.
content:
MELAKA (May 11): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) has never allowed any e-hailing service provider to use the price bidding system for passengers in the country, said Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook.

He said the ministry was not informed of the matter, and as a precaution, the Land Public Transport Agency (APAD) has been directed to investigate the system currently being used among e-hailing drivers.

“APAD will look into this, and as far as I know,

title: Anwar to undertake official visit to Qatar from Sunday to Tuesday
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim will undertake an official visit to Qatar from Sunday to Tuesday aimed at strengthening the long-standing relations and multifaceted cooperation between Malaysia and Qatar, said the Foreign Ministry.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 11): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim will undertake an official visit to Qatar from Sunday to Tuesday aimed at strengthening the long-standing relations and multifaceted cooperation between Malaysia and Qatar, said the Foreign Ministry.

The ministry, widely known as Wisma Putra, stated on Saturday that this inaugural visit by the prime minister, upon the invitation of the Amir of Qatar, Sheikh Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani, coincides with the 50th anniversary of the establishment of dipl

title: Viral message of US imposing sanctions on Malaysia is fake, says Fahmi
summary: A viral message claiming that Malaysia is the first Asean member country sanctioned by the US is fake, according to Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): A viral message claiming that Malaysia is the first Asean member country sanctioned by the US is fake, according to Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.

Fahmi, who is also the unity government spokesperson, said he had received a confirmation from the US Embassy that the viral message was fake news, while the international news agency, Reuters, also denied publishing a report containing such misinformation.

“Based on the denial b

title: Reuters says report on Malaysia listed as state sponsor of terror is false
summary: A news report attributed to Reuters that Malaysia is the first country in Southeast Asia to be listed by the US as a state sponsor of terror is false.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): A news report attributed to Reuters that Malaysia is the first country in Southeast Asia to be listed by the US as a state sponsor of terror is false. 

“Any claims that Reuters reported that Malaysia is the first country in Southeast Asia to be listed by the US as a state sponsor of terror are false,” the news agency posted on the X platform (formerly known as Twitter).

Reuters said it did not report th

title: Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election results expected to be known as early as 9pm
summary: The Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election results will be known as early as 9pm on Saturday, said Election Commission (EC) deputy chairman Dr Azmi Sharom.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 11): The Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election results will be known as early as 9pm on Saturday, said Election Commission (EC) deputy chairman Dr Azmi Sharom.

He expressed his confidence that the vote tallying process would go smoothly, thus allowing the results to be known early, and he expects the voter turnout for the by-election to be around 60%.

He said this when met by reporters after inspecting the voting process at the Sekolah Menengah K

title: Tech giants starting to treat Southeast Asia like next big thing, Bloomberg reports
summary: Long considered a tech hinterland, Southeast Asia is fast emerging as a centre of gravity for the industry.
content:
(May 11): Long considered a tech hinterland, Southeast Asia is fast emerging as a centre of gravity for the industry.

The chief executive officers of Apple Inc, Microsoft Corp and Nvidia Corp are among the industry chieftains who have swung through the region in past months, committing billions of dollars in investment and holding forth with heads of state from Indonesia to Malaysia. Amazon.com Inc just this week took over a giant conference hall in downtown Singapore to unfurl a US$9 billion (R

title: Cuscapi says SC has okayed trading of Worldcoin on digital asset exchanges in Malaysia
summary: Digital business solutions provider Cuscapi Bhd (KL:CUSCAPI) said Securities Commission Malaysia has approved its associate company MX Global Sdn Bhd to facilitate the trading of the Worldcoin (WLD) token on digital asset exchanges recognised by the SC.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): Digital business solutions provider Cuscapi Bhd (KL:CUSCAPI) said Securities Commission Malaysia has approved its associate company MX Global Sdn Bhd to facilitate the trading of the Worldcoin (WLD) token on digital asset exchanges recognised by the SC.

As such, WLD will now be included on the list of permitted digital assets to be traded along with bitcoin (BTC), bitcoin cash (BCH), Cardano (ADA), Chainlink (LINK), Ethereum (ETH), Litecoin (LTC), Ripple (XRP), Solana (SOL), Uniswao (UNI

title: Invest Selangor eyes RM7b transaction value from SIBS 2024
summary: Invest Selangor Bhd is eyeing up to RM7 billion in potential transaction value from the Selangor International Business Summit (SIBS) this year.
content:
BANGKOK (May 11): Invest Selangor Bhd is eyeing up to RM7 billion in potential transaction value from the Selangor International Business Summit (SIBS) this year.

Invest Selangor chief executive officer Datuk Hasan Azhari Idris said following the overwhelming response from last year's SIBS, the summit will be held twice this year to accommodate increasing demand.

"Last year, we managed to achieve about RM6 billion in potential transaction value, so we are confid

title: Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election: 55.79% turnout at 4pm
summary: Polling for the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) by-election saw 55.79% voter turnout as at 4pm on Saturday, as observers kept an eye on whether it could breach the 68.3% turnout seen in the 2023 Selangor state polls.

title: RHB pushes hard for desired growth
summary: RHB Bank Bhd (KL:RHBBANK) had gone through a challenging year in 2023, as the banking industry was busy defending narrowing net interest margins amid high funding costs as lenders competed fiercely for deposits.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 11): RHB Bank Bhd (KL:RHBBANK) had gone through a challenging year in 2023, as the banking industry was busy defending narrowing net interest margins amid high funding costs as lenders competed fiercely for deposits.

In an interview with The Edge, group managing director and group chief executive officer Mohd Rashid Mohamad shared his account of RHB’s approach to dealing with industry headwinds and outlined some of the opportunities management could leverage on to navigate the way fo

title: The Week Ahead: Malaysia’s 1Q GDP, US CPI data in focus
summary: It will be an eventful week for economic observers both locally and globally, as Bank Negara Malaysia is set to announce growth figures in the first quarter of 2024 (1Q2024) on May 17, while the US Bureau of Labour Statistics will release the consumer price index (CPI) for April on May 15.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on May 13, 2024 - May 19, 2024

It will be an eventful week for economic observers both locally and globally, as Bank Negara Malaysia is set to announce growth figures in the first quarter of 2024 (1Q2024) on May 17, while the US Bureau of Labour Statistics will release the consumer price index (CPI) for April on May 15.

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Hibiscus Petroleum Bhd plans to achieve 35-50 kilo barrels per day (kbpd) by 2026 from its current rate of 22kbpd. 

Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research stated that with net incremental barrels coming from the recently drilled Bunga Aster-1 under PM3 CAA by May 2024 as well as Teal West and South Furious 30 by the end of 2024, the Hibiscus production rate will grow to 27–28 kbpd by 2025.

title: HLIB research positive on Genting outlook
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) remains bullish on Genting Bhd's prospects, citing the anticipation of a sustained rebound in foreign tourist arrivals to both Malaysia and Singapore. The recent visa-free travel agreement between China and these ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) remains bullish on Genting Bhd's prospects, citing the anticipation of a sustained rebound in foreign tourist arrivals to both Malaysia and Singapore.

The recent visa-free travel agreement between China and these two countries is anticipated to boost Genting Singapore (GENS) and Genting Malaysia (GENM) earnings for the financial year 2024 (FY24), it said in a note.

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Mega First Corp Bhd is expected to see its topline grow threefold from its proposed acquisition of a 64-per cent stake in CSC Agriculture Holdings Sdn Bhd.

Public Investment Bank (PublicInvest) stated that Mega First's acquisition of CGC Agriculture would value the entire company at RM39 million.

title: Expert: Malaysia should add value in chip industry
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia should take proactive measures to shift from being a low-cost semiconductor hub to becoming a country known for providing value in the chip industry, says Research for Social Advancement (REFSA) deputy director Lim Li Lian.She said ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia should take proactive measures to shift from being a low-cost semiconductor hub to becoming a country known for providing value in the chip industry, says Research for Social Advancement (REFSA) deputy director Lim Li Lian.

She said that multinational companies (MNCs) often look at Malaysia as a choice for their facilities due to its mature ecosystem.

"Many of these companies opt to establish their largest and most advanced manufacturing capabilities in Penang and Kulim," she said in a statement, af

title: European firms souring on China, lobby group warns
summary: BEIJING: The proportion of European firms that rank China as a top investment destination has hit a record low, a European business lobby group said on Friday, warning that it could take years to restore confidence in the world's ...
content:
BEIJING: The proportion of European firms that rank China as a top investment destination has hit a record low, a European business lobby group said on Friday, warning that it could take years to restore confidence in the world's No.2 economy.

The European Chamber of Commerce in China said in the latest edition of its Business Confidence Survey that the outlook for doing business in China was also at its lowest in the report's 20-year history, with over a quarter of respondents pessimistic about their current growth p

title: OPR to stay at 3pc for rest of the year, say analysts
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Analysts project that Bank Negara Malaysia will keep the overnight policy rate (OPR) steady at 3.00 per cent for the rest of the year.Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) noted that Bank Negara maintains a positive outlook on ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Analysts project that Bank Negara Malaysia will keep the overnight policy rate (OPR) steady at 3.00 per cent for the rest of the year.

Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB) noted that Bank Negara maintains a positive outlook on Malaysia's growth prospects, fueled mainly by domestic demand and a favorable increase in exports.

The bank highlighted that inflation is forecast to stay moderate, yet it remains sensitive to potential shifts in domestic policies and global circumstances.

title: SC prepares market to tackle challenges arising from tech advancements
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Securities Commission (SC) is preparing the market to address challenges stemming from technological advancements through initiatives such as the Capital Market Cyber Simulation (CMCS) and the Guidelines on Technology Risk Management (GTRM). Chairman Datuk Seri Dr. Awang ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Securities Commission (SC) is preparing the market to address challenges stemming from technological advancements through initiatives such as the Capital Market Cyber Simulation (CMCS) and the Guidelines on Technology Risk Management (GTRM). 

Chairman Datuk Seri Dr. Awang Adek Hussin highlighted the rapid evolution of technology both domestically and globally, leading to a growing reliance on external service providers, particularly in areas such as artificial intelligence and cloud computing.

However, t

title: Bursa Malaysia rally to persist on string of positive news, undervalued equities
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Bursa Malaysia rally will likely continue, driven by a string of positive news and the attractiveness of "undervalued" Malaysian equities and ringgit, say an analyst.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Bursa Malaysia rally will likely continue, driven by a string of positive news and the attractiveness of "undervalued" Malaysian equities and ringgit, say an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the FTSE Bursa Malaysia's (FBM KLCI) price-earnings (PE) multiple was around 16 times compared to the long-term average of 17 times.

"The upside potential is visible considering that Malaysian equities are generally undervalued.

title: Mitigating backlash of a crisis
summary: I was awoken on a recent flight back to London with an announcement that we were rerouting to Brussels due to strange smells from the air conditioning ducts. Looking around at concerned faces, I immediately assumed we were flying in ...
content:
I was awoken on a recent flight back to London with an announcement that we were rerouting to Brussels due to strange smells from the air conditioning ducts. Looking around at concerned faces, I immediately assumed we were flying in an ill-fated Boeing aircraft—it was an Airbus.

Following Boeing's string of mishaps over the first quarter alone—The Alaska Airlines' cabin panel blowout, a United Airlines' wheel falling offand 787 Dreamliner safety concerns, to name a few – associating the established company with s

title: Eighteen polling centres open at 8am for Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election
summary: A total of 18 polling centres with 74 voting streams for the Kuala Kubu Baharu state by-election opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 11): A total of 18 polling centres with 74 voting streams for the Kuala Kubu Baharu state by-election opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday.

All the polling stations will be open until 6pm, except for Sekolah Jenis Kebangsaan Cina Bukit Fraser,  which will close at 2pm. It caters for only 40 voters.

A total of 39,269 voters are eligible to cast their ballots.

title: PM urges Sime Darby Plantation to pioneer less reliance on foreign labour
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has urged Sime Darby Plantation Bhd (KL:SIMEPLT) to be a supporter and pioneer of the government's efforts to reduce dependency on foreign labour in the plantation sector.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 10): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has urged Sime Darby Plantation Bhd (KL:SIMEPLT) to be a supporter and pioneer of the government's efforts to reduce dependency on foreign labour in the plantation sector.

In a Facebook post on Friday night, Anwar said the approach and technological advancement used by the plantation company should be emulated as a model by smallholders in the future.

Sharing about his working visit to the Sime Darby

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Earnings bolster US stocks
summary: A strong earnings season and blockbuster reports from tech industry titans fueled a US stock market rebound from the first real swoon of 2024. Next week’s inflation data could determine whether the good vibes continue.
content:
Some investors worry the rally could stall without evidence that inflation is cooling again.

NEW YORK: A strong earnings season and blockbuster reports from tech industry titans fueled a US stock market rebound from the first real swoon of 2024. Next week’s inflation data could determine whether the good vibes continue.

The benchmark S&P 500 index is up over 9% for the year, up near its late-March rec

title: Wall St posts another weekly gain ahead of inflation data
summary: US stocks eked out modest gains on Friday and all three indices posted another weekly advance as investors parsed comments from Federal Reserve officials and looked ahead to crucial inflation data next week.
content:
The Dow rose 125.08 points, or 0.32%, to 39,512.84, the S&P 500 gained 8.6 points, or 0.16%, to 5,222.68 and the Nasdaq dropped 5.40 points, or 0.03%, to 16,340.87.

NEW YORK: US stocks eked out modest gains on Friday and all three indices posted another weekly advance as investors parsed comments from Federal Reserve officials and looked ahead to crucial inflation data next week.

title: Oil falls on prospect of higher-for-longer US rates
summary: Oil prices fell by nearly US$1 a barrel on Friday as comments from US central bank officials indicated higher-for-longer interest rates, which could hinder demand from the world's largest crude consumers.
content:
Brent crude futures settled at US$82.79 a barrel, down US$1.09, or 1.3%. US West Texas Intermediate crude settled at US$78.26 a barrel, down US$1.00, or 1.3%.

NEW YORK: Oil prices fell by nearly US$1 a barrel on Friday as comments from US central bank officials indicated higher-for-longer interest rates, which could hinder demand from the world's largest crude consumers.

summary: Perak Corp Bhd has been given a six-month extension by Bursa Malaysia to submit its regularisation plan.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Perak Corp Bhd has been given a six-month extension by Bursa Malaysia to submit its regularisation plan.

title: Leap in operating income for UOB’s retail banking
summary: United Overseas Bank (M) Bhd (UOB Malaysia) has posted a record high RM4.6bil total operating income and pre-tax profit of RM1.9bil for its financial year ended 2023.
content:
The bank said its operating income jumped by 19.3% on-year, crossing the RM4bil mark for the first time.

PETALING JAYA: United Overseas Bank (M) Bhd (UOB Malaysia) has posted a record high RM4.6bil total operating income and pre-tax profit of RM1.9bil for its financial year ended 2023.

According to a statement, the bank said its operating income jumped by 19.3% on-year, crossing the RM4bil mark for the fi

title: Phison makes another attempt to enter Malaysia’s tech space
summary: In a move marking its return to Malaysia’s technology scene, Taiwanese electronics company, Phison Electronics Corp, is set to inject RM100mil into a startup named MaiStorage.
content:
Phison Electronics Corp co-founder, chairman and chief executive officer Pua Khein-Seng.

IN a move marking its return to Malaysia’s technology scene, Taiwanese electronics company, Phison Electronics Corp, is set to inject RM100mil into a startup named MaiStorage.

This initiative represents a fresh chapter for Phison, following its initial setback in 2012 when its first foray into Malaysia fell short.

title: Data centre – boon or bane?
summary: Data centres have been the flavour of our current times with stocks linked to such activities hitting their highs. The unstoppable digitalisation and “Big Data” wave sweeping over the country means data centres will continue to be the overarching hot topic of conversation.
content:
New industry: Engineers at a data centre. Malaysia has received US$16bil worth of investments for data centres between 2021 and March 2023.

DATA centres have been the flavour of our current times with stocks linked to such activities hitting their highs. The unstoppable digitalisation and “Big Data” wave sweeping over the country means data centres will continue to be the overarching hot topic of conversation.<

title: March industrial production index up 2.4%, but below forecast
summary: The industrial production index (IPI) rose 2.4% year-on-year (y-o-y) in March 2024, below expectations.
content:
Chief statistician Mohd Uzir said export-oriented industries rebounded to 0.5% in March 2024, from negative 0.2% in February 2024.

PETALING JAYA: The industrial production index (IPI) rose 2.4% year-on-year (y-o-y) in March 2024, below expectations.

According to 15 economists surveyed in a Reuters poll, March’s factory output had been forecast to expand 2.5% y-o-y.

title: Awantec, InNature, Paramount, Eco World International, Mi Technovation, MAA, KNM, Pharmaniaga, Jiankun, Nova MSC, Sarawak Cable
summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 10): Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Friday:

Bursa Malaysia Securities Bhd (Bursa Securities) has lifted AwanBiru Technology Bhd (KL:AWANTEC), formerly Prestariang Bhd, from its status as an affected listed issuer, after three years. Awantec said Bursa Securities has granted the company a waiver from being classified as an affected listed issuer, as it had complied with the criteria for the upliftment. The exchange regu
